intro: Pholidota repens, commonly known as the creeping pholidota, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly rough texture. Pholidota repens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along stream banks.
